result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M. Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2, credit for 200 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes: - Restitution set at $175.00 payable to G.T.

- Pay supervision fees during the term of probation and any unpaid balance converts to civil judgment.
- Court Order the defendant to pay All mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.
- Court waives all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to indigency.
- Any mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount determined by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Cash bail to apply if applicable.

- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, ammunition, and explosives, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- No new law violations.
- No contact with  C.F and G.

- Cooperate with agent. 
- MENTAL Health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Provide DNA Sample by 4/22/22 at 2:00pm.

- AODA Health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1, credit for 0 DAYS time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua M. Rogers

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek postconviction relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Pretrial credit forms
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Written explanation of determinate sentence received and filed

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: 

The Court Sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM in term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 
42 MONTHS CONCURRENT to COUNT 2, credit for 200 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, and the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  24 MONTHS. 

As to Count  2: 

The Court Sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM in term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 
42 MONTHS CONCURRENT to COUNT 1, credit for 0 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, and the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  24 MONTHS. 

 
The COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Correction for a period of  3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
- AODA/ MENTAL Health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Maintain/obtain fulltime employment or school
-Obtain GED 
- Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No contact with  C.F and G.T
- No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample by 4/22/22 at 2:00pm.
-Contact probation office.
- Pay supervision fees during the term of probation and any unpaid balance converts to civil judgment
-Court Order the defendant to pay All mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges 
- Court waives all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to indigency.
- Any mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount determined by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Cash bail to apply if applicable.
- Restitution set at $175.00 payable to G.T.

*Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 
*Court finds defendant IS eligible Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, ammunition, and explosives, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Joshua M. Rogers in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss.  Alexander Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing.  The plea and sentencing was held in person.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
signed and filed
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed.
Letters of support for defendant.
Received and Filed. Restitution Petition

Defendant Joshua M. Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Alexander Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant temporarily pled not guilty.
  
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Counts 1 and 2: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Amended Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, ammunition, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 45 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Restitution Order

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Alexander Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared via zoom.
Case in court for jury status hearing. Parties advise they have reached a resolution. Court will keep this case on the calendar for 1/24/2022 at 8:30am for resolution.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 1-20-22
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 1-20-22, filed.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Alexander Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Parties remain in a Jury Trial posture. Final pre-trial discussions held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 01/24/2022.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 12-16-21

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Alexander Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for Jury status hearing. Defendant out of custody. Speedy trial is mute at this time. Defense withdraws demand and request trial set for 10-25-2021 vacated. Case set on courts trial calendar, Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2021 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
21RM049714  Actual Date Bond Posted with sheriff 09/18/21

01:52 PM Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  Alexander Huber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua M Rogers appeared by video means with Attorney. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defendant's motion to dismiss is now moot. 

Final pre-trial conference held. 

As to Motion for Modification of Bail:
Arguments heard. Court GRANTS request for bail modification. Court orders cash bail in the amount of $3,500.00. $2,500.00 remains on filed. Defendant to pay an additional $1,000.00 cash bond. 




Court ordered case adjourned for jury status hearing scheduled for 10/21/2021 at 1:30 p.m. via Zoom.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery
Received and Filed. Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail
Received and Filed. Letter to Judge Kies
Received and Filed. Brief in Support of Motion to Dismiss
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion to Dismiss
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp 11/4/2021.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court via Zoom, defendant Joshua M Rogers not in court, in custody.  Michael David Graveley appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussions with parties regarding discovery and bail. Court will hold bail for recompense. Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL demand. Case adjourned to Branch 45 for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2021 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 25, 2021 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Carlos F., Tou T., and Ge T.

$2,500.00 cash bail was previously posted. Defendant to post an additional $5,000.00 cash bail.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.
Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  Michael David Graveley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua M Rogers appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return. Parties have received and reviewed the Doctor's Report. The parties do not dispute the findings and the Court reinstates the proceedings. The Court adopts the findings of the report, and finds the defendant competent to proceed. Defense has not received discovery or an offer in this case. Defense requests more time to determine case posture. Court ordered case adjourned to Br. 45 via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 6, 2021 at 08:30 am.
DA Case number changed from 2015ML006041 to 2021KN002771 due to special prosecution by ADA Michael D. Graveley, Kenosha County District Attorney.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Letter to the Court from Attorney Voss, received and filed.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services, signed and filed.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss both via video conferencing.  Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Parties have reviewed the doctor's report. State has no challenges. Defense takes no position. Doctor was unable to come to a conclusion in this matter and recommends the defendant be transferred to a DHS facility for further evaluation. Court ordered the proceedings suspended and defendant transported forthwith to a DHS facility by the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for an inpatient examination. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 25, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Letter from Doctor Collins requesting an extension to complete the evaluation, received and filed.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Richard L. Voss both via video conferncing.  Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Clerk contacted the Forensic Unit and the doctor requests additional time to evaluate the defendant. Defense counsel also raises the issue of a possible conflict as placed on the record. Court ordered case adjourned in Br 45 via Zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 25, 2021 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court via video conferencing, defendant Joshua M Rogers not in court, in custody. Defendant's appearance is waived for today's proceedings.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Warrant.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Defendant to remain remanded at this time due to competency proceedings. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case calendared for DOCTOR'S REPORT RETURN in Br 45 via Zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 5, 2021 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

BRANCH 28  for BRANCH 45:

Defendant has been picked up on warrant.  Case is adjourned for return of warrant in Branch 45 on April 16, 2021 at 8:30 a.m.

Clerk:  jms

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers not in court.  Attorney Jessica Bellows appears in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  The State indicated that the Defendant has not been cooperating with Justice Point.  Defendant failing to appear, the State requested a warrant.  The Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  The Court HELD OPEN forfeiture of any bail.
The 1/4/16 Jury Trial date is now a plea hearing.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (refused drug test), received and filed.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with Attorney Jessica Bellows.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Pre-Trial Conference.   The defense motioned that the GPS monitoring be removed as one of Defendant's conditions.  Arguments heard.  The Court DENIED the motion and ordered Defendant be continued on GPS monitoring.  The Court admonished hte Defendant for his violations.  The Court indicated that the Defendant has until December 4, 2015 to accept an offer from the State.  After that, all offers are off the table.  Matter is set for a Jury Trial on January 4, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Branch 30, Judge Conen's Court in Courthouse room 635.

- NO FILE IN COURT -

Justice Point Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Program Order; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Justice Point for processing.

Court ordered bail set at $2,500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Electronic Monitoring (GPS) for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) 24-hour curfew.  (2) Release privileges for attorney appointments only.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Joshua M Rogers not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and GRANTED.  Court ordered bail set at $2,500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Electronic Monitoring (GPS) for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) 24-hour curfew.  (2) Release privileges for attorney appointments only.

Case adjourned to 05-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  Nicholas Cerwin for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Telly Kemos-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to a conflict with the State Public Defender's Office, motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court orders defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Carlos F; Tou T; Ge T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua M Rogers in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  
Defendant Joshua M Rogers in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
